content.raw_markdown:
#  tar v0.4.44
A Rust implementation of a TAR file reader and writer. This library does not currently handle compression, but it is abstract over all I/O readers and writers. Additionally, great lengths are taken to ensure that the entire contents are never required to be entirely resident in memory all at once. 
  * [ #encoding ](https://crates.io/keywords/encoding)
  * [ #tar ](https://crates.io/keywords/tar)
  * [ #tarfile ](https://crates.io/keywords/tarfile)


  * [ Readme ](https://crates.io/crates/tar)
  * [ 79 Versions ](https://crates.io/crates/tar/versions)
  * [ Dependencies ](https://crates.io/crates/tar/dependencies)
  * [ Dependents ](https://crates.io/crates/tar/reverse_dependencies)


## Metadata
4 months ago 
2021 edition 
[ MIT ](https://choosealicense.com/licenses/mit) OR [ Apache-2.0 ](https://choosealicense.com/licenses/apache-2.0)
59.6 KiB 
## Install
Run the following Cargo command in your project directory:
cargo add tar
Or add the following line to your Cargo.toml:
tar = "0.4.44"
## Documentation
[ docs.rs/tar ](https://docs.rs/tar)
## Repository
[ github.com/alexcrichton/tar-rs ](https://github.com/alexcrichton/tar-rs)
## Owners
[ Report crate ](https://crates.io/support?crate=tar&inquire=crate-violation)

content.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate tarCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/src/tar/lib.rs.html#1-44)
Expand description
A library for reading and writing TAR archives
This library provides utilities necessary to manage [TAR archives](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tar_%28computing%29) abstracted over a reader or writer. Great strides are taken to ensure that an archive is never required to be fully resident in memory, and all objects provide largely a streaming interface to read bytes from.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/#structs)

[Archive](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Archive.html "struct tar::Archive")
    A top-level representation of an archive file.

[Builder](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Builder.html "struct tar::Builder")
    A structure for building archives

[Entries](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Entries.html "struct tar::Entries")
    An iterator over the entries of an archive.

[Entry](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Entry.html "struct tar::Entry")
    A read-only view into an entry of an archive.

[EntryWriter](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.EntryWriter.html "struct tar::EntryWriter")
    A writer for a single entry in a tar archive.

[GnuExtSparseHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.GnuExtSparseHeader.html "struct tar::GnuExtSparseHeader")
    Representation of the entry found to represent extended GNU sparse files.

[GnuHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.GnuHeader.html "struct tar::GnuHeader")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive

[GnuSparseHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.GnuSparseHeader.html "struct tar::GnuSparseHeader")
    Description of the header of a spare entry.

[Header](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Header.html "struct tar::Header")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive

[OldHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.OldHeader.html "struct tar::OldHeader")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive

[PaxExtension](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.PaxExtension.html "struct tar::PaxExtension")
    A key/value pair corresponding to a pax extension.

[PaxExtensions](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.PaxExtensions.html "struct tar::PaxExtensions")
    An iterator over the pax extensions in an archive entry.

[UstarHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.UstarHeader.html "struct tar::UstarHeader")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive
## Enums[§](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/#enums)

[EntryType](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/enum.EntryType.html "enum tar::EntryType")
    Indicate for the type of file described by a header.

[HeaderMode](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/enum.HeaderMode.html "enum tar::HeaderMode")
    Declares the information that should be included when filling a Header from filesystem metadata.

[Unpacked](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/enum.Unpacked.html "enum tar::Unpacked")
    When unpacking items the unpacked thing is returned to allow custom additional handling by users. Today the File is returned, in future the enum may be extended with kinds for links, directories etc.

# tar-rs
[Documentation](https://docs.rs/tar)
A tar archive reading/writing library for Rust.
```
```# Cargo.toml``
``[``dependencies``]`
`tar ``=` ``"`0.4`"``
``
```

## Reading an archive
```
``extern` `crate` tar`;`
`use` `std`::```io`::```prelude`::```*``;`
`use` `std`::```fs`::``File`;`
`use` `tar`::``Archive`;`
``fn` `main`````(````)``````{`
  `let` file `=` `File`::``open`(```"`foo.tar`"```)``.``unwrap``(``)``;`
  `let` `mut` a `=` `Archive`::``new`(`file`)``;`
  `for` file `in` a`.``entries``(``)``.``unwrap``(``)` `{`
    ``//` Make sure there wasn't an I/O error`
    `let` `mut` file `=` file`.``unwrap``(``)``;`
    ``//` Inspect metadata about the file`
    `println!``(```"``{:?}``"```,` file`.``header``(``)``.``path``(``)``.``unwrap``(``)``)``;`
    `println!``(```"``{}``"```,` file`.``header``(``)``.``size``(``)``.``unwrap``(``)``)``;`
    ``//` files implement the Read trait`
    `let` `mut` s `=` `String```::``new`(``)``;`
    file`.``read_to_string``(``&``mut` s`)``.``unwrap``(``)``;`
    `println!``(```"``{}``"```,` s`)``;`
  `}`
```}```
`
```

## Writing an archive
```
``extern` `crate` tar`;`
`use` `std`::```io`::```prelude`::```*``;`
`use` `std`::```fs`::``File`;`
`use` `tar`::``Builder`;`
``fn` `main`````(````)``````{`
  `let` file `=` `File`::``create`(```"`foo.tar`"```)``.``unwrap``(``)``;`
  `let` `mut` a `=` `Builder`::``new`(`file`)``;`
  a`.``append_path``(```"`file1.txt`"```)``.``unwrap``(``)``;`
  a`.``append_file``(```"`file2.txt`"```,` `&``mut` `File`::``open`(```"`file3.txt`"```)``.``unwrap``(``)``)``.``unwrap``(``)``;`
```}```
`
```

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate tarCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/src/tar/lib.rs.html#1-44)
Expand description
A library for reading and writing TAR archives
This library provides utilities necessary to manage [TAR archives](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tar_%28computing%29) abstracted over a reader or writer. Great strides are taken to ensure that an archive is never required to be fully resident in memory, and all objects provide largely a streaming interface to read bytes from.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/#structs)

[Archive](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Archive.html "struct tar::Archive")
    A top-level representation of an archive file.

[Builder](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Builder.html "struct tar::Builder")
    A structure for building archives

[Entries](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Entries.html "struct tar::Entries")
    An iterator over the entries of an archive.

[Entry](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Entry.html "struct tar::Entry")
    A read-only view into an entry of an archive.

[EntryWriter](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.EntryWriter.html "struct tar::EntryWriter")
    A writer for a single entry in a tar archive.

[GnuExtSparseHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.GnuExtSparseHeader.html "struct tar::GnuExtSparseHeader")
    Representation of the entry found to represent extended GNU sparse files.

[GnuHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.GnuHeader.html "struct tar::GnuHeader")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive

[GnuSparseHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.GnuSparseHeader.html "struct tar::GnuSparseHeader")
    Description of the header of a spare entry.

[Header](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Header.html "struct tar::Header")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive

[OldHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.OldHeader.html "struct tar::OldHeader")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive

[PaxExtension](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.PaxExtension.html "struct tar::PaxExtension")
    A key/value pair corresponding to a pax extension.

[PaxExtensions](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.PaxExtensions.html "struct tar::PaxExtensions")
    An iterator over the pax extensions in an archive entry.

[UstarHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.UstarHeader.html "struct tar::UstarHeader")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive
## Enums[§](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/#enums)

[EntryType](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/enum.EntryType.html "enum tar::EntryType")
    Indicate for the type of file described by a header.

[HeaderMode](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/enum.HeaderMode.html "enum tar::HeaderMode")
    Declares the information that should be included when filling a Header from filesystem metadata.

[Unpacked](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/enum.Unpacked.html "enum tar::Unpacked")
    When unpacking items the unpacked thing is returned to allow custom additional handling by users. Today the File is returned, in future the enum may be extended with kinds for links, directories etc.

Expand description
A library for reading and writing TAR archives
This library provides utilities necessary to manage TAR archives⟨4⟩ abstracted over a reader or writer. Great strides are taken to ensure that an archive is never required to be fully resident in memory, and all objects provide largely a streaming interface to read bytes from.
## Structs§⟨5⟩

enriched_crate.name: tar

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate tarCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/src/tar/lib.rs.html#1-44)
Expand description
A library for reading and writing TAR archives
This library provides utilities necessary to manage [TAR archives](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tar_%28computing%29) abstracted over a reader or writer. Great strides are taken to ensure that an archive is never required to be fully resident in memory, and all objects provide largely a streaming interface to read bytes from.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/#structs)

[Archive](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Archive.html "struct tar::Archive")
    A top-level representation of an archive file.

[Builder](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Builder.html "struct tar::Builder")
    A structure for building archives

[Entries](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Entries.html "struct tar::Entries")
    An iterator over the entries of an archive.

[Entry](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Entry.html "struct tar::Entry")
    A read-only view into an entry of an archive.

[EntryWriter](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.EntryWriter.html "struct tar::EntryWriter")
    A writer for a single entry in a tar archive.

[GnuExtSparseHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.GnuExtSparseHeader.html "struct tar::GnuExtSparseHeader")
    Representation of the entry found to represent extended GNU sparse files.

[GnuHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.GnuHeader.html "struct tar::GnuHeader")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive

[GnuSparseHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.GnuSparseHeader.html "struct tar::GnuSparseHeader")
    Description of the header of a spare entry.

[Header](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.Header.html "struct tar::Header")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive

[OldHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.OldHeader.html "struct tar::OldHeader")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive

[PaxExtension](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.PaxExtension.html "struct tar::PaxExtension")
    A key/value pair corresponding to a pax extension.

[PaxExtensions](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.PaxExtensions.html "struct tar::PaxExtensions")
    An iterator over the pax extensions in an archive entry.

[UstarHeader](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/struct.UstarHeader.html "struct tar::UstarHeader")
    Representation of the header of an entry in an archive
## Enums[§](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/#enums)

[EntryType](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/enum.EntryType.html "enum tar::EntryType")
    Indicate for the type of file described by a header.

[HeaderMode](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/enum.HeaderMode.html "enum tar::HeaderMode")
    Declares the information that should be included when filling a Header from filesystem metadata.

[Unpacked](https://docs.rs/tar/latest/tar/enum.Unpacked.html "enum tar::Unpacked")
    When unpacking items the unpacked thing is returned to allow custom additional handling by users. Today the File is returned, in future the enum may be extended with kinds for links, directories etc.

enriched_crate.readme_summary: The `tar` crate provides a streaming interface for reading and writing TAR archives without requiring them to be fully loaded into memory. It includes tools for creating archives (`Builder`), iterating over entries (`Entries`), and accessing or modifying headers and metadata (`Header`, `EntryType`, etc.). The crate supports various TAR formats, including GNU and UStar, and offers flexibility for handling sparse files and PAX extensions.
enriched_crate.factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1:
✅ Factual: The `tar` crate provides a streaming interface for reading and writing TAR archives, ensuring that an archive does not need to be fully loaded into memory.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `tar` crate requires the entire TAR archive to be loaded into memory before processing any entries.

---

### Pair 2:
✅ Factual: The `tar::Builder` struct allows users to create TAR archives by incrementally adding files or entries.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `tar::Builder` struct can only create TAR archives by preloading all files into memory before writing them to the archive.

---

### Pair 3:
✅ Factual: The `tar::Archive` struct provides an iterator (`Entries`) to sequentially access each entry in a TAR archive.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `tar::Archive` struct requires users to manually parse and locate entries in the TAR archive without providing an iterator abstraction.
